content.tagline: Accomplished IT professional with over 16 years of experience. Proven talent in automation, scripting, deep-dive knowledge transfer, pattern recognition, and conflict de-escalation. History of developing non-traditional solutions to unconventional problems, works extremely well in cooperative and cross-functional environments. Dark mode enthusiast.

skills.name: Full Stack Development
skills.description: Use modern technologies and frameworks including React, Node.js, IBM Carbon, Java, Swagger, and others

skills.name: Product Support
skills.description: Represent the company to internal and external clients for a wide variety of deployments to resolve issues and satisfy concerns.

skills.name: Troubleshooting
skills.description: Quickly and efficiently identify components of a failing system and restore functionality using an intimate knowledge of the technology

skills.name: Desktop and Server Administration
skills.description: Designed, implemented, and maintained multiple server and desktop environments using technologies such as QRadar 7.2.7-7.5.0, RHEL 6-8, OpenShift 4.7, Windows Server 2003-2012, Norton Ghost, Microsoft SCCM 2007/2012, Citrix XenDesktop 5.5/XenApp 6.5, VmWare View, Unidesk, and Blackberry Enterprise Server

skills.name: Hardware and Software
skills.description: Familiarity with all aspects of server and workstation hardware installation and maintenance of internal components and peripherals. All versions of Windows since XP/2003, many flavors of Linux since Debian 4, Mac OSX 10.7, iOS, and Android

skills.name: Programming Languages
skills.description: Extremely proficient with Bash and Powershell, comfortable in Python, node.js, Perl, Go, and Ansible.

skills.name: Networking and Homelab
skills.description: Self-taught ESXi, Docker, Cisco VLANs, pfsense, Freenas, Jellyfin, Plex, Windows and Linux based DHCP/DNS/PXE, PSQL, Grafana, application hosting

experience.title: Full Stack Developer, IBM Solve
highlights: React, Node, IBM Carbon, Java, Postgres, and more as needed

experience.title: L2 QRadar Weekend Squad Lead
highlights: Redesigned internal wikis from the ground up to easily facilitate system-down troubleshooting. Shared framework with other squads and assisted with implementation.
Established standardized Salesforce Case Prioritization View so that all agents have a single list of cases to pick from without confusion, eliminating the need to assign cases and tasks manually.
Report to first line management weekly, upper management monthly.
Designed custom reporting solution to show consistent squad improvement when existing report features prevented accurate statistics.
Developed and presented brown bag training classes to team members to improve the department's overall efficiency.

experience.title: L2 QRadar Product Support
highlights: Worked on four separate teams to resolve cases at a monthly rate of 200% above expectation.
SME topics include Deployment Configuration, Docker Applications, SSL Certificates, system-down, and weekend communication.
Help lead the Support Tools team to identify gaps in capabilities, develop tools and documentation to automate resolution of frequent and repetitive issues.
Join calls with development to discuss and escalate defects.
Provide swarming assistance to other agents and process end-of-shift handoffs.

experience.title: MSIEM Administrator
highlights: Plan, install, maintain, optimize, and troubleshoot QRadar SIEM 7.2.8+ for clients under contract with IBM MSS.
Write scripts in various languages to automate and optimize nagios monitoring as well as processes and procedures both for internal and external teams.
Document processes and procedures on internal team wiki.
Drive issues to resolution, escalating to internal, client, vendor management, and development as necessary.
Participate in internal projects to increase MSS ability to support various scenarios.

experience.title: System Support Technician
highlights: Sole engineer responsible for deployment and maintenance of over 2000 endpoints and 250+ applications across eight sites using technologies such as Microsoft SCCM 2007/2012, Citrix XenDesktop 5.5/XenApp 6.5, and Norton Ghost.
Rearchitected above systems from sneakernet to touchless PXE/Scheduled Deployments
Ensured compatibility of applications and user experience throughout different environments.
Deploy critical and security patches to desktops via WSUS, as well as applicatble Citrix Hotfixes via phased rollout strategy.
Create, troubleshoot, and maintain Active Directory and Group Policy objects relating to student computers, users, and applications.
Plan and implement hardware and software replacement lifecycle.
Provide secondary support for PEN systems (teleconferencing, A/V).
Assist management and training of helpdesk staff.

experience.title: Adjunct Instructor
experience.highlights: Taught classes including Technical Support Concepts, Troubleshooting Windows 7, Fundamentals of Wireless, Client/Server Virtualization, Data Communications (A+/Network+), Internet Security, and Project Management, as requested.

experience.title: Tier II Blackberry Support Technician
highlights: Support Blackberry Enterprise Server for large entities including Facebook, Visa, and the Department of Defense.
Provided assistance to other agents to determine the best possible solution to a client's particular issue.
Maintained a low call time and high rate of problem resolution

experience.title: System/Network Administrator, Web Designer, Computer Technician
highlights: Planned, installed, and maintained Cisco voice/data networks and Windows domains in a wide variety of local business and home environments.
Performed diagnostics and troubleshoooting on hardware and software for desktops, laptops, and servers at commerical and residential locations.
Responded to 24/7 on-call emergencies.
Designed multiple websites using hand-written standard-compliant HTML/PHP and various CMS's such as Joomla! and Drupal.
